dialogue_turns.speaker: Narrator
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty-seventeen, Brussels. The European Union agrees to its first-ever joint debt issuance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty-seventeen, Brussels. The European Union agrees to its first-ever joint debt issuance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After intense negotiations, the EU agreed to issue joint debt for the first time ever to finance the Recovery and Resilience Facility, a common fund that will provide grants and loans to EU member states to green the economy, digitalize our public administrations, and reform the blocs sluggish economies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The Recovery and Resilience Facility, a 750 billion euro fund—grants and loans to green economies and digitalize public services across the bloc.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Recovery and Resilience Facility, a seven hundred fifty billion euro fund-grants and loans to green economies and digitalize public services across the bloc.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But the real test is whether that money actually gets to where it's supposed to go, right? Not into the pockets of corrupt officials or con artists.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the real test is whether that money actually gets to where it's supposed to go, right? Not into the pockets of corrupt officials or con artists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And they've built in these really stringent reporting rules, plus oversight from bodies like the European Anti-Fraud Office and the new European Public Prosecutor's Office.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And they've built in these really stringent reporting rules, plus oversight from bodies like the European Anti-Fraud Office and the new European Public Prosecutor's Office.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result, the legal text governing the distribution of funds includes stringent obligations on reporting and transparency, as well as essential oversight roles for the EUs monitoring bodies: the European Anti-Fraud Office, the newly operational European Public Prosecutors Office, and the European Court of Auditors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is so necessary, given what's happened before. Like in Slovakia, the murder of that journalist Ján Kuciak was tied to his investigation into EU fund misuse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is so necessary, given what's happened before. Like in Slovakia, the murder of that journalist Ján Kuciak was tied to his investigation into E U fund misuse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2018, a series of investigations tied the murders of journalist Jn Kuciak and his fiance Martina Kunrov to his investigation into the misuse of EU funds in Slovakia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there was Bulgaria, where ministers resigned after embezzling agricultural subsidies. Hungary too—a 1.7 billion euro transport project with serious irregularities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there was Bulgaria, where ministers resigned after embezzling agricultural subsidies. Hungary too-a one point seven billion euro transport project with serious irregularities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The following year, several ministers in Bulgarias government stepped down after revelations that they had embezzled EU agricultural funds to acquire real estate. In Hungary, the EUs anti-fraud office uncovered serious irregularities in a 1.7 billion ($2 billion) transport project and in contracts negotiated with the prime ministers son-in-law to provide street lighting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Over six billion in misspent subsidies between 2014 and 2019. That's a staggering number.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Over six billion in misspent subsidies between twenty fourteen and twenty nineteen. That's a staggering number.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In total, between 2014 and 2019, the anti-fraud body recommended the recovery of over 6 billion in subsidies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So now with this huge new fund, the risk is even higher. But the resources for oversight… they're actually shrinking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So now with this huge new fund, the risk is even higher. But the resources for oversight... they're actually shrinking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The latest cut follows a decade-long trend of slashing resources for the anti-fraud body. In 2010, the office had 466 employees; this year, that number is 376, even though the money that needs supervising has more than doubled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like the anti-fraud office staff went from 512 employees in 2010 down to 290 now, while the money they have to monitor has more than doubled.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like the anti-fraud office staff went from five hundred twelve employees in twenty ten down to two hundred ninety now, while the money they have to monitor has more than doubled.

dialogue_turns.text: Each staffer responsible for 600 million in expenditures? That's just not realistic oversight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Each staffer responsible for six hundred million in expenditures? That's just not realistic oversight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, in the latest EU budget proposal, the European Commission assumes that each staff member in the anti-fraud office will monitor 900 million worth of EU expenditures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the European Court of Auditors and the Public Prosecutor's Office are stretched thin too. It's a recipe for problems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the European Court of Auditors and the Public Prosecutor's Office are stretched thin too. It's a recipe for problems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The resources of the European Court of Auditors and the European Public Prosecutors Office are similarly inadequate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The EPP proposed amendments to boost funding for these bodies, which makes sense. You can't have historic spending without historic oversight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The E P P proposed amendments to boost funding for these bodies, which makes sense. You can't have historic spending without historic oversight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This dangerous combination prompted Renew Europe (the successor to the Alliance of Liberals and Democrats for Europe in the European Parliament) to present amendments to the budget to increase substantially the resources of the EUs audit and control bodies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: If this ends in scandals, it could really damage the whole project—and future political unity. Europeans expect results, not fraud headlines.
